pullrequest.title: Link's linear vel and CoG vel

content.raw:
Also, we should specify what frame the offset is expressed in.

For example, if a sphere is rolling without slip on a flat plane, the velocity of the sphere at the contact point should be zero (or a small number). If the origin of the sphere frame is the center of the sphere, the location of the contact point in the world frame is just Vector3(0, 0, -radius). In a body-fixed frame, the offset to the contact point will depend on the orientation of the sphere and is more complicated.

I think using the body-fixed frame for the offset will be used more frequently, but there will be times that its easier to use other frames (especially for spinning bodies).
